meanings.definition: Denoting a period of time in the past that was idyllically happy and peaceful.
meanings.sent1: The small town had a halcyon summer, filled with laughter and sunshine.
meanings.sent2: The memories of her halcyon childhood days always brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent3: In the halcyon days of his youth, he believed anything was possible.
meanings.sent4: The old photographs captured the halcyon moments of their family vacations.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted a halcyon scene of a peaceful countryside.

meanings.definition: A mythical bird said by ancient writers to breed in a nest floating at sea at the winter solstice, charming the wind and waves into calm.
meanings.sent1: Legends tell of the halcyon, a magical bird that calms the stormy seas.
meanings.sent2: Sailors believed sighting a halcyon bird meant safe travels ahead.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled imagining a halcyon bird singing lullabies to the ocean.
meanings.sent4: The sailor's heart was lifted at the sight of the halcyon gracefully gliding above the waves.
meanings.sent5: The painting featured a majestic halcyon perched on a wave, bringing peace to the waters.
